pr_title: Introduce MethodName orderer to replace deprecated Alphanumeric

timeline.message:
Remove  @Deprecated anotation from Alphanumeric method orderer

Adding @Deprecated causes the full build to fail as they configure to
fail on compile warnings. The deprecation is still declared in the @API
annotation and described in the javadoc.

Introduce MethodName orderer to replace deprecated Alphanumeric

With the introduction of DisplayName orderer in 6fee44d, the name of the
Alphanumeric orderer becomes ambiguous ie "Alphanumeric of what?".
MethodName is a better name. It is unambiguous, it clearly states what
it is using for ordering the tests and it's naming is consistent with
the new orderer DisplayName.

Resolves: #2334

Introduce MethodName orderer to replace deprecated Alphanumeric

With the introduction of DisplayName orderer in 6fee44d, the name of the
Alphanumeric orderer becomes ambiguous ie "Alphanumeric of what?".
MethodName is a better name. It is unambiguous, it clearly states what
it is using for ordering the tests and it's naming is consistent with
the new orderer DisplayName.

Resolves: #2334

timeline.author: juliette-derancourt
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -104,15 +105,35 @@ return Optional.of(ExecutionMode.SAME_THREAD); } + /** + * {@code MethodOrderer} that sorts methods alphanumerically based on their + * names using {@link String#compareTo(String)}. + * + *

If two methods have the same name, {@code String} representations of + * their formal parameter lists will be used as a fallback for comparing the + * methods.

+ *

This class has been deprecated in favor of {@code MethodOrderer.MethodName} and will be + * removed in 6.0

+ * + * @since 5.4 + * @deprecated Deprecated in favor of MethodOrderer.MethodName. Will be removed in 6.0 + */ + @API(status = DEPRECATED, since = "5.4")

replies.bodyText:
I misunderstood the API.since value to describe since when the API existed as is the since in javadoc. While this describes status changes.
Thanks for pointing it out!
replies.author: gaganis

timeline.bodyText: Please use {@link MethodOrderer.MethodName} to point towards the new class.
timeline.author: juliette-derancourt

timeline.bodyText: Should we leave this one until we delete the orderer completely? Or remove it right away?
timeline.author: juliette-derancourt

 	 * The {@link MethodOrderer} to use.

replies.bodyText: I wanted where we mention it to have a comment about the deprecation. In this case with @see section a comment does not render nicely so I opted not to include it.
replies.author: gaganis

timeline.author: juliette-derancourt

timeline.bodyText:
I'm not sure about this one... Personally I'd prefer to leave it the way it is, to be 100% sure it will not break things for users. (It's probably unlikely but... we never know 🤓)
What do you think?
